explanation:
Reasoning for each required symbol (concise):

- OS_ObjectIdGetById: Direct callee of OS_CountSemDelete. Any for-loops inside it or its effects are considered part of the behaviour of the for-loop body in the caller; its body must be inspected for MISRA violations.
- OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit, OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex, OS_ObjectIdConvertToken, OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel: These are direct callees of OS_ObjectIdGetById (from the static graph). Their bodies must be examined because they are executed as part of OS_ObjectIdGetById and could contain for-loops or modify objects used as loop counters/flags.
- OS_CountSemDelete_Impl: Direct callee of OS_CountSemDelete; its implementation is part of the overall behaviour and must be checked for any for-loops and whether they obey the loop-counter/side-effect constraints.
- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: Callee of OS_CountSemDelete_Impl. Include it because it may contain loops or modify objects used as loop counters.
- OS_ObjectIdFinalizeDelete: Direct callee of OS_CountSemDelete. Its body (and callees) must be checked for for-loops and side effects impacting loop counters or flags.
- OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish, OS_NotifyEvent: Callees of OS_ObjectIdFinalizeDelete. Include them because their code contributes to the behaviour of OS_ObjectIdFinalizeDelete and may contain for-loops or modify objects relevant to loop correctness.
- UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType, UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData, UT_ExecuteBasicHandler, UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr: These test/stub infrastructure symbols appear in the static call graph for OS_CountSemDelete. If present in the build, their implementations may execute within or alongside the call chain and could contain for-loops; include them to be safe.
- OS_object_token_t: Type of the local variable token passed to callees. Its definition is required to determine whether fields of the token are used as loop counters or are modified in called functions (affecting the rule about objects modified in loop bodies).
- osal_id_t: Type of the sem_id parameter. Include to resolve whether any uses of the ID in called functions are treated as loop counters or otherwise influence loop conditions.
- OS_SUCCESS, OS_LOCK_MODE_EXCLUSIVE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE: Macros/constants used in the call to OS_ObjectIdGetById. Their values/semantics may influence control flow in callees; include to fully understand conditional execution paths that could include for-loops.

In short: include all direct callees and their immediate callees (per the static graph), the test-stub helpers listed, and the token/ID types and the constants used in the call so that every function executed as part of OS_CountSemDelete (and any code they invoke) can be inspected for for-loops and for whether any loop counters or loop-control flags are modified in bodies, thus allowing a complete MISRA for-loop well-formedness analysis.
